Midgard: The realm of humanity, central in the cosmic tree Yggdrasil. A place of transition and the primary battlefield for the forces of light and dark.
Alfheim: The home of the Light Elves, a realm of ethereal beauty and blinding radiance, governed by the benevolent Frey.
Asgard: The golden fortress of the Aesir gods, ruled by Odin. It stands at the highest point of the world tree, accessible only via the Bifrost.
Jotunheim: A rugged land of ice and stone, home to the giants. It is a place of ancient wisdom and primal danger.
Vanaheim: The lush, mystical home of the Vanir gods, masters of sorcery and fertility. A realm where nature and magic are one.
Nidavellir: The subterranean halls of the master craftsmen, the Dwarves. Deep within the earth, they forge the most powerful artifacts of the cosmos.
Muspelheim: A realm of eternal flame and primordial heat, ruled by the giant Surtr. It is the source of all fire in the universe.
Niflheim: The primordial world of ice and mist, a land of shadows and freezing darkness located at the roots of Yggdrasil.
Helheim: The cold and dreary realm of the dishonorable dead, ruled by the goddess Hel. A final destination for those who do not fall in battle.
